meanings.definition: The art of taking close-up photographs of small subjects.
meanings.sent1: Macrophotography allows us to see tiny details in things we never noticed before.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy practicing macrophotography in my garden to capture the beauty of insects.
meanings.sent3: When I tried macrophotography on a grain of sand, it looked like a huge mountain!
meanings.sent4: Her macrophotography skills were like a magnifying glass revealing hidden worlds.
meanings.sent5: The magic of macrophotography lies in revealing the intricate beauty of small objects.

meanings.definition: The practice of capturing detailed images of tiny objects.
meanings.sent1: With macrophotography, you can zoom in on the tiniest details of a flower petal.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often use macrophotography to showcase the delicate patterns on butterfly wings.
meanings.sent3: I attempted macrophotography on a sugar crystal, and it looked like a sparkling diamond!
meanings.sent4: His macrophotography work was so detailed, it felt like looking through a microscope.
meanings.sent5: Through macrophotography, the world of small objects becomes a vast landscape of wonders.

meanings.definition: The technique of photographing small items at a very close range.
meanings.sent1: Using macrophotography, you can capture the texture of a leaf in incredible detail.
meanings.sent2: Macrophotography is essential for capturing the fine features of jewelry in advertisements.
meanings.sent3: I tried macrophotography on a drop of water, and it looked like a crystal ball!
meanings.sent4: In the world of macrophotography, even the smallest objects become grand.
meanings.sent5: The precision of macrophotography reveals the hidden beauty of everyday objects.
